Params[3]: How do you have the time to make something like this when you've barely rested recently...
Lee puts down the terminal in his hand and takes the mystery box resignedly.
I wonder if I should admire your endless energy or scold you for your poor time management.

Params[2]: It's a rare festival, after all. You want to open it?

Params[3]: Lee swiftly opens the box and finds a small planetarium globe inside.
The level of detail on these constellations can easily be calculated without this globe.
With that, Lee makes use of the planetarium to explain to you a series of common constellations and their coordinates.

Params[2]: ...My computing power is limited to a regular human brain.

Params[3]: Even humans can work this out... Forget it. Since you realize you're a human, why don't you stick to the resting schedule of one?
Go to sleep. I'll show you any constellation you want to see once you're well-rested, no matter how far away they are.
